reason: The '_journalSizeThreshold' configuration in the Prevayler software project directly influences how much data is retained in the journal before it is purged. A lower threshold may lead to more frequent purging and potentially increased execution time as the system has to handle more frequent write operations. Conversely, a higher threshold could result in increased memory consumption and longer recovery times when the system restarts, as more data needs to be processed. Therefore, changes to this configuration can significantly impact both execution time and memory usage, classifying it as performance-sensitive.
